metadata.subject: Suit Against California Relies on a Court Case Won by Obama in 2012; Investigating Sexual Misconduct Accusations, Arizona State Suspends a Physicist

organizations: U.S. House Committee on Oversight and Accountability
School of Earth and Space Exploration

relationships.description: Sessions/DOJ is suing California over sanctuary laws
Krauss is a professor suspended pending investigation
BuzzFeed reported sexual misconduct allegations against Krauss

analysis.purpose: To report on two separate news stories: legal battle over California sanctuary laws and suspension of physicist over sexual misconduct allegations
analysis.significance: Highlights ongoing political/legal conflicts between federal and state governments on immigration policy, and #MeToo movement consequences in academia

concerns: Potential unconstitutional commandeering of state resources

notable_quotes: "California is in the business of public safety," he said. "We are not in the business of deportations."
"Has my language or demeanor sometimes made others feel uncomfortable? Clearly yes, and for that I sincerely apologize."
red_flags: Multiple organizations cutting ties with Krauss suggests serious allegations
Federal government suing its own state over policy differences

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion found in this news article

illegal_activity.description: This is a news article reporting on legal and investigative matters involving third parties

details: Thomas Fuller and Kenneth Chang as reporters

public_knowledge.context: These were public news stories covering significant political/legal conflicts and high-profile academic misconduct allegations

analysis.summary: This document contains two New York Times news articles: one about the Justice Department's lawsuit against California's sanctuary laws modeled on a previous Obama-era case against Arizona, and another about Arizona State University suspending physicist Lawrence Krauss over sexual misconduct allegations reported by BuzzFeed.
